resources.string: Lost & Survive
Not Available

1. Take clothes that minimizes sweat loss. Wear white or others that is light in color.
 2. Take sunglasses hat and gloves if you have any.
 3. Store your water in different cans, so that if leaked the total water won’t get wasted
 4. Take foods that includes salt and potassium Food is not a priority in a desert emergency. If you are out of water, only eat the minimum required to function.
 5. Before setting out for desert pack the survival equipment, Ropes, blankets, water purification tablet, knife etc.

1. Become nocturnal. It’s cold at night so walking would cause less sweat. This single decision will save your body about three liters (three quarts) of water per day.
 2. Stay in shelter during day.
 3. signal for help. Make a fire at day to use the smoke, use a torch at night. (photo)
 4. Find water sources. If there's been a rainstorm recently, you may find pockets of water in rock outcrops or flat stone surfaces. More often, you'll need to search for areas with possible groundwater:
 Follow animal tracks leading downhill, birds circling around something, or even flying insects.
 Walk to the greenest vegetation you can see, especially large plants with wide leaves.
 Follow canyons or dry river beds upstream, and look for a depression, especially on the outside edge of a bend.
 Look for a slope of hard, non-porous rock, where rainwater would run into the soil. Dig in the sand or soil at the base of this slope.
 In developed areas, look for buildings or troughs. When the sun is low, its glare will reflect off distant metal objects and water collection structures.
 5. stay away from animals and cactuses.

1. Look for others if you had a boat or plane crush.
 2. Get everything you can gather, water, food supply cloths, knifes, matches etc.
 3. Find a source of drinking water and source of food.
 4. Make a shelter. (see how to make one)
 5. stay in the beach and give signal to get help.
 Write something in the sand in large scale so that any sea-plane notices. Light up fire and create smoke, if there is a mountain light up the fire in the top of the mountain like the story “Fire on The Mountain” by William Golding.
 6. Try to purify the water to avoid water contaminated diseases (go to details).
 7. Trap animals for food using a deadfall trap. (go to details) 
 8. Try to catch some fish for protein. (go to details)

1. Make a detailed travel plan and make sure that each person traveling with you has a copy of it. This plan should also include meeting points in case something happens that causes you to get separated from the group.
 2. Aside from having first aid supplies, one or more people in the group should be trained in how to handle medical emergencies. It will also be helpful if this person knows how to use natural medicines.
 3. Try to travel with at least 2 other people. It is not advisable to travel alone.
 4. Everyone in the hiking party should have their own backpack equipped with basic survival supplies. This should include a compass, map, mirror, small first aid kit, whistle, flashlight, a fully charged cell phone or satellite phone (with emergency phone numbers), and bright colored material to attract aerial rescuers.
 5. It is important to always bring food or water with you even through it is only a day hike.
 6. Each member of the party should have a compact water filter system and water purification tablets.
 7. Bring an emergency blanket and a tarp to help you stay warm.
 8. Pack the correct clothing for the time of year. If it is cool or cold, then pack clothing that can be worn in layers to put on or take off as necessary.
 9. Bring the correct type of gear for the time of year. This could include snowshoes, cross country skies, insulated boots or ice grippers for the boots.
 10. If you are going to be in a snowy country, be sure to pack your emergency beacon and emergency airbag. When activated, the airbag will give you more buoyancy, which helps to keep you on top of the avalanche.

First, DO NOT PANIC!
 You must stop, stay calm, stay put and make your plan.
 Sit down, eat and drink something. This will calm you down and give you a chance to make a plan.
 Panicking can only make it worse for you. The last thing you want to do is go thrashing around further away from a viable trail or deeper into the mountain wilderness. If it is getting late in the day and you are in a safe area, it may be best to make camp and get a good night’s rest before starting again in the morning.
 If you feel you are lost do not start running or walking faster than your normal pace. If you do, you risk the chance of falling in the mountainous terrain.
 Never split from the group or split the group up. If you do so, the rescue party will be looking for two groups of people instead of one.

1. Take waterproof matches and lighter.
 2. Ointment for insect bites specially for mosquitos.
 3. Take some medicines according to your need.
 4. Extra batteries, power banks.
 5. Sleeping bag, tents.
 6. Try to wear waterproof shoes.
 7. Carry a whistle, obviously you are not travelling alone, if you get lost somehow the whistle will come in handy.

1. Do not touch the wildlife unless you know about them.
 2. Find a source of drinking water and source of food.
 3. Find a shelter. (see how to make one)
 4. Travel in one direction during daylight hours.
 5. Try to purify the water to avoid water contaminated diseases (go to details).
 6. Trap animals for food using a deadfall trap. (go to details) 
 7. Try to catch some fish for protein. (go to details)
Pre-travelling
Survival
1. Take clothes that minimizes sweat loss. Wear white or others that is light in color
2. Take sunglasses hat and gloves if you have any
3. Store your water in different cans, so that if leaked the total water won’t get wasted
4. Take foods that includes salt and potassium Food is not a priority in a desert emergency. If you are out of water, only eat the minimum required to function
5. Before setting out for desert pack the survival equipment, Ropes, blankets, water purification tablet, knife etc.
1. Become nocturnal. It’s cold at night so walking would cause less sweat. This single decision will save your body about three liters (three quarts) of water per day.
2. Stay in shelter during day
3. Signal for help. Make a fire at day to use the smoke, use a torch at night

4. Find water sources. If there has been a rainstorm recently, you may find pockets of water in rock outcrops or flat stone surfaces. More often, you will need to search for areas with possible groundwater:
Follow animal tracks leading downhill, birds circling around something, or even flying insects. Walk to the greenest vegetation you can see, especially large plants with wide leaves. Follow canyons or dry river beds upstream, and look for a depression, especially on the outside edge of a bend. Look for a slope of hard, non-porous rock, where rainwater would run into the soil. Dig in the sand or soil at the base of this slope. In developed areas, look for buildings or troughs. When the sun is low, its glare will reflect off distant metal objects and water collection structures
5. Stay away from animals and cactuses

2. Ointment for insect bites specially for mosquito
3. Take some medicines according to your need
4. Extra batteries, power banks
5. Take sleeping bag, tents
6. Try to wear waterproof shoes
7. Carry a whistle, obviously you are not travelling alone, if you get lost somehow the whistle will come in handy
1. Do not touch the wildlife unless you know about them
2. Find a source of drinking water and source of food
3. Find a shelter
4. Travel in one direction during daylight hours
5. Try to purify the water to avoid water contaminated diseases
6. Trap animals for food using a deadfall trap
7. Try to catch some fish for protein
i) Get a long bamboo stalk to use as your spear
ii) Use a knife to cut cross hairs into the tip so tht the end of the spear separates into four individual prongs
iii) Seperate the prongs with vine to keep them apart
iv) Stand on a rock overlooking the river or stream
v) Wait for a fish to come within striking range, then jab at it with the spear to catch it
i) Find a large branch and lean one end up onto a tree
ii) Place smaller branches at 45 degree angles along the length of the large branch
iii) Cover the entire structure with leaves and foliage
i) Gather three branches and a heavy stone
ii) Cut notches in the branches as indicated in the illustration below
iii) Hold up the rock with one hand, while positioning sticks "A" and "C"
iv) Once the weight of the rock is resting on "A" and "C", use your free hand to insert and mount the trigger stick "B"
v) Let go and the trap should be balanced and set
vi) When a bird or animal comes along to eat the bait, the trigger trick will trip and the rock will kill the fatal blow
i) Dig a hole into soil
ii) Place a container in the center of the hole
iii) Fill the gaps surrounding the container with anything wet, such as leaves
iv) Place a plastic sheet over the hole and anchor the sheet in place with larger rocks around the edges of the hole
v) Place one small rock in the center of the plastic, just over the container
vi) Condensation will occur on the underside of the plastic and run down to the center. It will drip into the container filling it with distilled water

1. Make a detailed travel plan and make sure that each person traveling with you has a copy of it. This plan should also include meeting points in case something happens that causes you to get separated from the group

2. Aside from having first aid supplies, one or more people in the group should be trained in how to handle medical emergencies. It will also be helpful if this person knows how to use natural medicines
3. Try to travel with at least 2 other people. It is not advisable to travel alone

4. Everyone in the hiking party should have their own backpack equipped with basic survival supplies. This should include a compass, map, mirror, small first aid kit, whistle, flashlight, a fully charged cell phone or satellite phone (with emergency phone numbers), and bright colored material to attract aerial rescuers
5. It is important to always bring food or water with you even through it is only a day hike
6. Each member of the party should have a compact water filter system and water purification tablets
7. Bring an emergency blanket and a tarp to help you stay warm
8. Pack the correct clothing for the time of year. If it is cool or cold, then pack clothing that can be worn in layers to put on or take off as necessary
9. Bring the correct type of gear for the time of year. This could include snowshoes, cross country skies, insulated boots or ice grippers for the boots

10. If you are going to be in a snowy country, be sure to pack your emergency beacon and emergency airbag. When activated, the airbag will give you more buoyancy, which helps to keep you on top of the avalanche
1. First, DO NOT PANIC!
2. You must stop, stay calm, stay put and make your plan
3. Sit down, eat and drink something. This will calm you down and give you a chance to make a plan

4. Panicking can only make it worse for you. The last thing you want to do is go thrashing around further away from a viable trail or deeper into the mountain wilderness. If it is getting late in the day and you are in a safe area, it may be best to make camp and get a good night’s rest before starting again in the morning
5. If you feel you are lost do not start running or walking faster than your normal pace. If you do, you risk the chance of falling in the mountainous terrain
6. Never split from the group or split the group up. If you do so, the rescue party will be looking for two groups of people instead of one
i) Find small pieces of wood, tinder, or twigs and arrange them in a small tepee
ii) Having good tinder is important. Try using dry grass, pine resin, birch tree bark or any other dry material that will easily take a flame.
iii) Locate a length of soft wood. Ideally this will have a small groove in it already. However, you could also make a grove by cutting the wood with a sharp stone.
iv) Find a hardwood stick and gather your tinder together.
v) Put the tinder in the groove. Rub the hardwood stick up and down the groove quickly to create friction.
vi) Eventually the tinder will ignite. Place this tinder in your small kindling tepee to start the fire.
vii) Add larger pieces of wood to build the fire higher

Hi this is …
I am lost,please help me immediately
My Phone Number:
Location information:
1. Double check and make sure that you have all of the proper vaccinations and that you have renewed all essential prescriptions
2. Bring copies of your passport. If your passport gets stolen or lost you want to be sure that you can still get back into the country, or be able to prove your citizenship
3. Leave a copy of your passport. For extra backup, leave a copy of your passport at home or with someone you trust. Consider making an electronic copy you can store in your email account as well
4. Register with your embassy. If there’s a problem in the country, this will make it easier for your government to contact you and get you to safety

5. Make sure your credit card will work in the country you’re visiting. European banks have switched almost completely to the more secure chip-and-PIN technology, and fewer businesses abroad are accepting the outdated magnetic-stripe cards
6. Always have local cash. Not every place takes credit cards. Especially important places like trains or buses

7. Get guidebooks. Guidebooks usually include maps, key words or phrases, and give you enough detail on certain sites that you won’t need to purchase the pamphlet at the venue. And download apps before you travel. Avoid downloading charges from your wireless carrier and get your apps before you leave
8. Bring a charger adapter. Countries have different size plugs and voltage. So if you want to use your iPod, make sure you can charge it
9. Take power banks with you, so that your phone remains charged
1. If you are lost, don’t panic, use this app and find your location
2. If have lost anything or if your bag is snatched then use the app to find your way to the nearest police station
3. If you feel sick, use the app to get to the nearest hospital to you
4. You may find your direction using the compass
